alert.note: Alert for Webster; Wright (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 9:19AM CST until February 20 at 12:25AM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. Reports of 1 to 3 inches of rainfall. Several reports of flooded state highways and low-lying areas. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Missouri, including the following counties, in south central Missouri, Dent, Howell, Shannon and Texas. In southwest Missouri, Christian, Douglas, Stone, Taney, Webster and Wright. * WHEN...Until 915 PM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 918 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ozark, Branson, Salem, Mountain Grove, Ava, Mountain View, Kimberling City and Forsyth. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
